content: right-hand dominant stay at home mom
Status post open reduction internal fixation, left wrist with Dr. Andrew Rice

She presents today for evaluation of her left wrist stiffness that has persisted since her wrist injury.  She states that at the time of her injury and immediate post-op protocol, she was diagnosed with complex regional pain syndrome and she has made a lot of progress since then, but she is still unable to extend her wrist enough to do a push-up.  She is able to do her Pilates.  She does her Pilates regularly without pain or limitation, slumps and modifications, but she cannot extend enough to do a push-up.  She is here for evaluation and treatment.

data: She presents for evaluation of her left wrist stiffness that has persisted since her left distal radius fracture in October 2023.  She was diagnosed with CRPS at the time of her injury. She has made a lot of progress since then, but she is still unable to extend her wrist enough to do a push-up. She is able to do Pilates regularly without pain or limitation, with slight modifications. She cannot extend her wrist enough to do a push up.

content: X-rays postop, a well healed fracture with stable and intact hardware

data: X-ray of the left wrist, post-op, showed a well-healed fracture with stable hardware. Plate alignment looks good and the overall reduction looks adequate.

title: Assessment
